{{BLP sources|date=July 2013}} {{Infobox person | name = Max Greenfield | image = Max Greenfield at the 2013 Golden Globe Awards (cropped).jpg | caption = Greenfield at the [[70th Golden Globe Awards|Golden Globe Awards]] in 2013 | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|mf=yes|1980|9|4}} | birth_place = [[Dobbs Ferry, New York]], U.S. | residence = [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], U.S. | occupation = Actor | years_active = 2000–present | spouse = {{marriage|Tess Sanchez|2008}} | children = 2 }} '''Max Greenfield''' (born September 4, 1980){{cite web|author=Char Adams |url=http://www.people.com/article/sally-field-max-greenfield-kiss-ellen-degeneres-show |title=Max Greenfield and Sally Field Kiss on Ellen DeGeneres Show |website=People.com |date=2016-03-07 |accessdate=2016-11-17}}{{cite web|url=http://www.nwitimes.com/entertainment/columnists/offbeat/offbeat-mary-poppins-and-south-pacific-among-marriott-s-season/article_1d17ee09-bbc5-567b-93c9-57b3367a1da0.html?comment_form=true |title=OFFBEAT: 'Mary Poppins' and 'South Pacific' among Marriott's 2013 season | OffBeat with Phil Potempa |website=Nwitimes.com |date=2016-11-10 |accessdate=2016-11-17}}{{cite web| url=http://www.recapo.com/live-with-kelly-ripa/live-with-kelly-interviews/kelly-michael-max-greenfield-35th-birthday-new-girl-review/ | title=Kelly & Michael: Max Greenfield 35th Birthday + New Girl Review | last=Lempel | first=Robin | publisher=Recapo | accessdate=June 6, 2016}} Part of a recap of Season 27, Episode 6 of ''[[Live! with Kelly and Michael]]'', which aired September 8, 2014. is an American actor. He appeared in recurring roles in ''[[Veronica Mars]]'' and ''[[Ugly Betty]]'', and co-starred in the [[The WB|WB]] series ''[[Modern Men]]''. He co-starred as [[Schmidt (New Girl)|Schmidt]] in the [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]] sitcom ''[[New Girl]]'', for which he received [[Emmy Award|Emmy]], [[Critics' Choice Television Award|Critics' Choice Television]], and [[Golden Globe Award|Golden Globe]] awards nominations, and the voice of Roger in the [[Ice Age (franchise)|''Ice Age'' franchise]]. ==Career== Greenfield began pursuing his acting career in 1998 after he graduated from high school. He landed guest appearances on dramas such as ''[[Boston Public]]'', ''[[Gilmore Girls]]'' and ''[[The O.C.]]'' Greenfield scored his first lead role on the short-lived series ''[[Modern Men]]'' as one of three bachelors who hire a [[life coach]] to help them understand and manage women. Greenfield had more success in supporting roles on ''[[Veronica Mars]]'' (reprising the role in the [[Veronica Mars (film)|film adaptation]] in 2014) and ''[[Greek (TV series)|Greek]]''. In 2007 he landed a recurring role on ''[[Ugly Betty]]''. He continued his television career with a slew of guest-starring roles on [[primetime]] series such as [[The CW]]'s remake of ''[[Melrose Place]]'', the short-lived ''[[No Ordinary Family]]'', and ''[[Castle (TV series)|Castle]]''. He created, produced, and starred in the comedy series ''The Gentlemen's League'' for the [[Audience Network]] in 2010, which followed the real-life fantasy football league he ran with actor [[Jerry Ferrara]].{{cite web |url=https://tv.yahoo.com/person/max-greenfield/biography.html |title=Max Greenfield |publisher=[[Yahoo! TV]] |accessdate=July 25, 2014}} As for film, Greenfield had his feature film debut in the film ''Cross Bronx''. Greenfield had a featured role in ''[[When Do We Eat? (2006 film)|When Do We Eat?]]'', as an Internet tycoon who, after losing his fortune, becomes a [[Hasidic Jew]]. In 2011, Greenfield began playing the role of Schmidt in the sitcom ''[[New Girl]]''. The role earned him nominations for both a [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Comedy Series]] and a [[Golden Globe Award for Best Supporting Actor – Series, Miniseries or Television Film]].{{cite web|url=https://movies.yahoo.com/person/max-greenfield/biography.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-05-03 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130927213445/http://movies.yahoo.com/person/max-greenfield/biography.html |archivedate=2013-09-27 |df= }} In 2015, Greenfield starred in a series of [[McDonald's]] commercials promoting their Sirloin Third Pound Burgers.{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/burgerbusiness/max-greenfield-will-mcdon_b_7233622.html|title=Max Greenfield Will Be McDonald's Sirloin Pitchman|date=May 7, 2015|work=[[Huffington Post]]|accessdate=May 30, 2015}} ==Personal life== Greenfield was born and raised in [[Dobbs Ferry, New York]]. He is [[Judaism|Jewish]] and had a ''[[Saturday Night Live]]''-themed [[Bar and Bat Mitzvah|Bar Mitzvah]].{{cite news|url=https://www.gq.com/entertainment/movies-and-tv/201201/max-greenfield-interview-new-girl|title=The GQ&A: Max Greenfield|last=Bans|first=Lauren|date=January 2012|work=[[GQ]]|accessdate=January 11, 2012}} He has been married to casting director Tess Sanchez since 2008. They have two children, Lilly (born 2009) and son Ozzie (born 2015).{{cite web|url=http://www.goop.com/journal/see/199/max-greenfields-emmy-experience |title=Max Greenfield’s Emmy Experience |website=Goop.com |date= |accessdate=2016-11-17}}{{cite web|last=Rapkin |first=Mickey |url=http://www.elle.com/pop-culture/celebrities/max-greenfield-interview |title=The Max Factor |website=Elle.com |date=2013-01-25 |accessdate=2016-11-17}}{{cite news |url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-moms/news/max-greenfield-wife-tess-sanchez-welcome-baby-no-2-2015258 |title=New Girl's Max Greenfield, Wife Tess Sanchez Welcome Baby No. 2: Find Out His Name! |last=Corneau |first=Allison |work=[[US Magazine]] |date=2015-08-25 |accessdate=2016-11-24}} ==Philanthropy== Max Greenfield has worked with [[Young Storytellers Foundation]] on numerous occasions, stating that his own kids have inspired him to help children find self-confidence and creativity.{{cite web|last1=Bhatt|first1=Rakhee|title=Max Greenfield on Young Storytellers & Whether or Not We'll Ever Find out Schmidt's First Name on 'New Girl'|url=http://la-confidential-magazine.com/max-greenfield-on-young-storytellers-and-new-girl-season-6|website=Los Angeles Confidential|publisher=Greengale Publishing|accessdate=21 October 2016}} ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ Film !
